intro: Dorstenia yangambiensis, commonly known as the Yangambi star, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped inflorescence. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered a delicate and specialized species.
